body_html:
In this link: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45865665/getting-reproducible-results-using-tensorflow-gpu?newreg=4a6ec43834884576a175961e7f2188db

They mentioned that the tf.reduce_sum function has been fixed in a certain commit to solve the tensorfow-gpu non-determistic problem.

Has anyone tried the nightly build version in GPU mode? can it resolve the non-deterministic problem?
body_text:
In this link: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45865665/getting-reproducible-results-using-tensorflow-gpu?newreg=4a6ec43834884576a175961e7f2188db

Has anyone tried the nightly build version in GPU mode? can it resolve the non-deterministic problem?
body:
In this link: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45865665/getting-reproducible-results-using-tensorflow-gpu?newreg=4a6ec43834884576a175961e7f2188db

They mentioned that the tf.reduce_sum function has been fixed in a certain commit to solve the tensorfow-gpu non-determistic problem. 

Has anyone tried the nightly build version in GPU mode? can it resolve the non-deterministic problem?
